column2: Chemically engineering diatoms and algae for novel battery material

Data produced for MRes eeChange research project. Algae and diatoms were cultured in chemically-enhanced media, phosphate for algae and aluminium/zinc for diatoms. RFU measurements were taken to monitor growth rates
The result show that the higher the concention of phosphate added to the media where algae was cultured, the higher the growth rate. However, there is inhibition for the diatoms in some treatments.
chlorophyll fluorometer (Trilogy, Loratory Fluorometer 7200-000, setting: chl-A)
Green algae Chlamydomonas Pulvinata, and diatoms Thalassiosira Pseudonana and Thalassiosira Weissflogii were used in this project
Green algae was cultured in freshwater of different concentrations of phosphates. 3 flasks per concentration.
Diatoms were cultured in seawater of different concnetrations of aluminium or zinc. 3 flasks per concentration.
500 uL of sample was diluted with 2 mL of respective media. RFU measurements were taken daily at 8 am. 3 times per flask.
Nafisah cultured, harvested, purified and prepared the samples for the analysis.
Daily_RFU contains the daily RFU readings of each sample.
C. pulvinata, T. pseudonana, or T. weissflogii
Phosphate for C. pulvinata, aluminium or zinc for diatoms
Concentration of phosphate, aluminium or zinc for each treatment
The number of days from algae/diatoms first added to the treatment
